political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: Did you know you could go to prison for missing a phone call aka a "technical violation"? Technical violations are minor infractions like missing a meeting, failing to pay a fine, or breaking curfew. Chadarion missed a probation check-in after his son accidentally threw his phone in the toilet. For that, he was sent to the infamous Parchman prison, where he tragically took his life 13 days later due to abuse. The current probation system fails to protect public safety, wastes taxpayer dollars, and traps individuals in a cycle of punishment. No one should die over a missed call. It's time to transform probation and parole into pathways for success. Learn more about REFORM's work and how to get involved‚Äîlink in bio. #probation #parole #reformalliance #criminaljusticereform #criminaljustice #criminaljusticesystem #incarcerated #formerlyincarcerated #prisonsystem

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è TW: Suicide/Violence/Sexual Abuse Cheryl Henderson‚Äôs son, Chadarion, worked 16-hour shifts to cover his costly parole fees while caring for his family. Despite always being compliant, one day his young son accidentally dropped his phone in the toilet, preventing him from checking in with his parole officer. For missing that single call‚Äîa technical violation, not a crime‚ÄîChadarion was immediately penalized and sent to Parchman Prison in Mississippi.  In just 13 days, the severe abuse he endured led to his tragic death by suicide. Hundreds of thousands of people are incarcerated each year for technical violations like missed calls or curfew breaches. It‚Äôs time to demand a fairer, safer system that offers common-sense solutions. Join Cheryl Henderson at REFORM‚Äôs #FutureofJustice Panel at the DNC, where she will advocate for change on behalf of her son Chadarion. üì© RSVP now. political_content.text: The 2024 election is here, and it‚Äôs time to talk to candidates and lawmakers about their plans for improving our supervision and criminal justice system. political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: REFORM Alliance leadership @Meek Mill ,@WALLO267 , JessicaJackson, and Erin Haney joined forces with New Jersey Governor, Phil Murphy, in Newark, NJ to unveil a groundbreaking Clemency Initiative. This initiative aims to give victims of domestic violence, individuals on supervision with outdated sentences, nonviolent offenders, and others a second chance at rebuilding their lives. It‚Äôs about restoring hope, dignity, and opportunity for those unfairly trapped in the system. We commend Governor Murphy for his bold leadership in advancing justice reform. This marks a pivotal moment, focusing on rehabilitation and reintegrating individuals into their communities. Join us in supporting this transformative step towards a more equitable justice system and spread the good news! The state also launched a website to serve as a home base for those seeking more information on the Governor‚Äôs executive clemency initiative: nj.gov/clemency. #criminaljusticereform #clemency #njgovernor

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: ‚ÄúGiving someone a #secondchance means that my daughter and I can live in a community where people have an opportunity to thrive and families stay together. Too often, our supervision system keeps people trapped, rather than putting them on a pathway to work, stability, and wellness. That‚Äôs why #secondchances are so important - and they cannot happen without the partnership of the community providing opportunities and supporting those who want to contribute back to society. Every single one of us has benefitted from a second chance at some point in our life. And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so proud to lead the Indiana Secure Communities Coalition. We have an amazing group of organizations and individuals from across the political spectrum working to transform our state‚Äôs supervision system into one that creates stronger, safer, and more meaningful second chances for Hoosiers.‚Äù - Maranda Williams, Indiana State Organizer üëêJoin Me! üëê https://bit.ly/3K4qVHp

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: Unstable housing is one of the most significant contributing factors to youth vulnerability and violence in Indianapolis. üè† According to Kia Wright, Founder of @voicescorp, many kids are abandoned by their parents and end up in repeated run-ins with law enforcement, further straining family bonds and creating a devastating cycle that lacks the basic support they need. ‚ÄúThey need love, they need attention. They need to be affirmed in who they are. There's a huge narrative out there about young people that I'm trying to change,‚Äù says Wright. Voices is an Indianapolis-based organization that looks to empower struggling youth to enhance their life. The west side apartment complex, known as Jake‚Äôs Place, aims to provide young adults with housing and assistance, but also teach them how to live independently. Thank you @voicescorp for providing Indianapolis youth with a #secondchance, and the necessary resources to not only survive but thrive. We are so lucky to have you as an Indiana Secure Communities Coalition partner. ‚ù§Ô∏è

There are thousands of PO‚Äôs that support our work to modernize the system. Most people become PO‚Äôs because they want to help people, only to run into a system that ties their hands with a one-size-fits-none approach. Share this if you think we can do better! political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: Will this be the year probation reform happens in Iowa?! HF 349 is a #probation incentives bill that encourages individuals on probation to pursue education, gain employment, and seek treatment. We already know this works. Incentive programs dramatically decrease repeat offenses, which currently cost Iowa $104 million/year. Our bill focuses on incentivizing workforce development, contributing to a stronger economy, and improving quality of life. Act Now to Support #HF349, we need this! :link: IN BIO #probationreform #iowa #probation #formerlyincarcerated #incarcerated #prisonreform #criminaljustice #criminaljusticereform

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: On November 6th, 2017, a pivotal moment unfolded in a Philadelphia courtroom, igniting a movement for justice in the probation and parole system. There, Wallace "Wallo267" Peeples stood alongside many, witnessing the injustice firsthand. That pivotal moment, along with the unwavering commitment of Meek Mill, Michael Rubin, and Jay-Z, gave birth to REFORM Alliance. Five years later our mission is clear. We aim to transform probation and parole by changing laws, systems, and culture to create real pathways to work and well-being. We work to replace America's criminal justice system with a restorative approach that is fair, accountable, and invested in rehabilitation. Our goal is for people to reenter society with dignity, create meaningful pathways to work, and equip them with the tools to succeed, all while making families and communities safer and stronger. Today, we embark on a new chapter with immense pride. We're thrilled to announce Wallace "Wallo267" Peeples as our new Chief Marketing Officer! Wallace's story resonates deeply with REFORM's core values. His journey, marked by both struggle and strength, embodies the transformative power of second chances. His voice, amplified by his platform, is a powerful tool to champion our mission. As CMO, Wallace will be the driving force behind amplifying REFORM's message, mobilizing support, and driving tangible change in our justice system. His leadership, combined with his unique skills will bring our mission to an even wider audience. Join us in welcoming Wallace @WALLO267  Peeples to the REFORM family! #probationreform #changethesystemtogether #secondchances

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: Here's a fact: access to higher education reduces the likelihood of individuals returning to prison. But here's another fact: most individuals trapped in the system are not afforded the chance to pursue higher education. Thankfully, there are some incredible programs that exist to bridge this gap while breaking down harmful barriers and stigmas - like the @iuindianapolis class. This unique class brings together campus students studying criminal justice and impacted individuals. They're not only discussing topics like race, racism, sexuality, implicit bias, religion, and politics but also sharing their personal experiences. Our brilliant Indiana state organizer Maranda Williams (@randa019) came to learn more about the program and discuss the reforms we're working to pass in Indiana. Maranda Williams leads the Indiana Secure Communities coalition: a diverse coalition of reentry providers, academics, faith leaders, directly impacted individuals, public servants, advocates, and employers working to improve Indiana's criminal justice system. #criminaljusticereform #changethesystemtogether #indianacheck #indianauniversity #reform #criminaljusticemajor

political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: There‚Äôs a workforce crisis in Iowa impacting every industry, and every Iowan is paying the price.¬† Iowa has more job openings than people without jobs, and there are fewer Iowans working today than nearly a decade ago. Chair of the Parole Board in Iowa, Helen Miller, explains how people under supervision remain an untapped talent pool. She stresses the need for vocational programs to help individuals under supervision hone new skills. These programs not only help individuals find stability and safety, but significantly aid the employee shortage. üé§Ô∏è: Iowa State Organizer, @KamMiddlebrooks, leads the Iowans United For Opportunity a coalition: a group of concerned citizens working to improve the Hawkeye State‚Äôs probation system and build stronger, safer, and more prosperous communities. #iowa #iowans #changethesystemtogether #criminaljusticereform #probationreform

political_content.text: üîÅ ICYMI: We had a major win in IL! üéâ @govpritzker signed supervision reform bill #SB423 in downtown Chicago this past summer alongside our CEO @rdrooks, @meekmill, @michaelrubin along with several other leaders and community activists. political_content.author: reform
political_content.text: The thing about being on supervision is that it‚Äôs like a second sentence.  Even if you‚Äôre doing all the right things, and staying on track, there‚Äôs always a chance you can be sent back to prison for breaking an arbitrary rule, like forgetting to report a traffic ticket.  At Reform, we believe individuals should be held accountable, and also ‚Äì that they should be given the tools and guidance to get their lives back on track.  What is one thing you wish was different about the supervision system?

videos.author: reform
videos.text: üëã Meet David Safavian: General Counsel and Executive Vice President at @cpac, and a passionate advocate for criminal justice reform. As a justice-impacted leader, Safavian has committed his career to transforming the justice system from punitive to rehabilitative, inspired by his own personal journey and experiences. Safavian's work emphasizes that justice reform isn‚Äôt a partisan issue‚Äîit's about common sense solutions that prioritize rehabilitation over punishment, breaking cycles of harm, and creating safer communities for everyone. Do you think the system should be focused on rehabilitating people and ending cycles of harm? Y/N Share this to your story if you believe fixing a broken system is not radical but common sense. #CJReform #CriminalJustice #RightOnCrime #SmartJustice #REFORMAlliance

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Did you know you could go to prison for missing a phone call aka a "technical violation"? Technical violations are minor infractions like missing a meeting, failing to pay a fine, or breaking curfew. Chadarion missed a probation check-in after his son accidentally threw his phone in the toilet. For that, he was sent to the infamous Parchman prison, where he tragically took his life 13 days later due to abuse. The current probation system fails to protect public safety, wastes taxpayer dollars, and traps individuals in a cycle of punishment. No one should die over a missed call. It's time to transform probation and parole into pathways for success. Learn more about REFORM's work and how to get involved‚Äîlink in bio. #probation #parole #reformalliance #criminaljusticereform #criminaljustice #criminaljusticesystem #incarcerated #formerlyincarcerated #prisonsystem

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Our Future of Justice Reform panel at the DNC was epic! üî• We were honored to bring together such a diverse group of lawmakers, advocates, and cultural icons each contributing unique perspectives and solutions to the pressing issues in justice reform. üí¨ü§ù A special thank you to our distinguished speakers and all of the attendees who came out! Yo Gotti - @yogotti Gov. Wes Moore Gov. Josh Shapiro - @governorshapiro A.G. Dana Nessel - @dananessel A.G. Kwame Raoul Speaker Pro Tempore Jehan Gordon-Booth Asm. Matt Haney Rep. Jordan Harris Speaker Don Scott Vic Mensa - @vicmensa Joakim Noah Cheryl Henderson Mrs. Gwen Walz Did you know? Over 4.3 million people are currently under federal supervision in the U.S. This widespread issue impacts individuals, families, and entire communities across our nation. At REFORM, we‚Äôre focused on breaking barriers that keep individuals trapped in the system. We know we can increase public safety, lower recidivism and strengthen communities by ensuring that individuals have the resources and opportunities needed to successfully reintegrate and thrive. üîóYou in? Let‚Äôs continue to build on this momentum and work towards a justice system that truly serves everyone. Join the movement [Link in bio] #FutureOfJustice #JusticeReform #REFORMAlliance #DNC2024 #CriminalJusticeReform

videos.author: reform
videos.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è TW: Suicide/Violence/Sexual Abuse Cheryl Henderson‚Äôs son, Chadarion, worked 16-hour shifts to cover his costly parole fees while caring for his family. Despite always being compliant, one day his young son accidentally dropped his phone in the toilet, preventing him from checking in with his parole officer. For missing that single call‚Äîa technical violation, not a crime‚ÄîChadarion was immediately penalized and sent to Parchman Prison in Mississippi.  In just 13 days, the severe abuse he endured led to his tragic death by suicide. Hundreds of thousands of people are incarcerated each year for technical violations like missed calls or curfew breaches. It‚Äôs time to demand a fairer, safer system that offers common-sense solutions. Join Cheryl Henderson at REFORM‚Äôs #FutureofJustice Panel at the DNC, where she will advocate for change on behalf of her son Chadarion. üì© RSVP now. FREE to attend. http://bit.ly/REFORMxDNC #DNC2024 #FutureofJustice #REFORMDNC #CriminalJusticeReform #JusticeForAll #TechnicalViolations@Team Roc @United Justice Coalition

videos.author: reform
videos.text: The 2024 election is here, and it‚Äôs time to talk to candidates and lawmakers about their plans for improving our supervision and criminal justice system. Let‚Äôs make sure we‚Äôre all making informed choices when we vote in November. With the Republican National Convention last week and the Democratic National Convention coming up in August, REFORM is spotlighting powerful stories from people impacted by the system. We‚Äôre showcasing smart safety solutions and bold leadership from both parties that enhance safety and create opportunities for millions. As a bipartisan organization, REFORM doesn‚Äôt endorse any candidate or political party. We‚Äôre dedicated to collaborating with leaders across the political spectrum to champion effective reforms that make the system fairer and more effective for everyone. #RNC #RepublicanNationalCovention #DNC #DemocraticNationalConvention #RNCinMKE #demconvention

videos.author: reform
videos.text: REFORM Alliance leadership @Meek Mill ,@WALLO267 , JessicaJackson, and Erin Haney joined forces with New Jersey Governor, Phil Murphy, in Newark, NJ to unveil a groundbreaking Clemency Initiative. This initiative aims to give victims of domestic violence, individuals on supervision with outdated sentences, nonviolent offenders, and others a second chance at rebuilding their lives. It‚Äôs about restoring hope, dignity, and opportunity for those unfairly trapped in the system. We commend Governor Murphy for his bold leadership in advancing justice reform. This marks a pivotal moment, focusing on rehabilitation and reintegrating individuals into their communities. Join us in supporting this transformative step towards a more equitable justice system and spread the good news! The state also launched a website to serve as a home base for those seeking more information on the Governor‚Äôs executive clemency initiative: nj.gov/clemency. #criminaljusticereform #clemency #njgovernor

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Yesterday we closed #Juneteenth a day of remembrance and celebration - here are two powerful reminders from from our CEO @rdrooks and CMO @wallo267, that we all have a role to play in the work for justice ahead. Happy Juneteenth everyone!

videos.author: reform
videos.text: ‚ÄúGiving someone a #secondchance means that my daughter and I can live in a community where people have an opportunity to thrive and families stay together. Too often, our supervision system keeps people trapped, rather than putting them on a pathway to work, stability, and wellness. That‚Äôs why #secondchances are so important - and they cannot happen without the partnership of the community providing opportunities and supporting those who want to contribute back to society. Every single one of us has benefitted from a second chance at some point in our life. And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so proud to lead the Indiana Secure Communities Coalition. We have an amazing group of organizations and individuals from across the political spectrum working to transform our state‚Äôs supervision system into one that creates stronger, safer, and more meaningful second chances for Hoosiers.‚Äù - Maranda Williams, Indiana State Organizer üëêJoin Me! üëê https://bit.ly/3K4qVHp

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Unstable housing is one of the most significant contributing factors to youth vulnerability and violence in Indianapolis. üè† According to Kia Wright, Founder of @voicescorp, many kids are abandoned by their parents and end up in repeated run-ins with law enforcement, further straining family bonds and creating a devastating cycle that lacks the basic support they need. ‚ÄúThey need love, they need attention. They need to be affirmed in who they are. There's a huge narrative out there about young people that I'm trying to change,‚Äù says Wright. Voices is an Indianapolis-based organization that looks to empower struggling youth to enhance their life. The west side apartment complex, known as Jake‚Äôs Place, aims to provide young adults with housing and assistance, but also teach them how to live independently. Thank you @voicescorp for providing Indianapolis youth with a #secondchance, and the necessary resources to not only survive but thrive. We are so lucky to have you as an Indiana Secure Communities Coalition partner. ‚ù§Ô∏è

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Imagine the mental health effects you‚Äôd feel if you could be thrown in prison for being late to a meeting. Probation and parole should set people up for success, not failure. The outdated supervision system worsens mental health and puts officers in difficult situations forcing them to violate people for being minutes late to a meeting. There are thousands of PO‚Äôs that support our work to modernize the system. Most people become PO‚Äôs because they want to help people, only to run into a system that ties their hands with a one-size-fits-none approach. Share this if you think we can do better! Thank you @spudbrooklyn and @Brittany | Your Favorite P.O.  #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth

videos.author: reform
videos.text: This #secondchancemonth, let‚Äôs prioritize mental health for returning citizens.  We need to uplift legislation that supports successful reintegration and include mental health care. Share this post if you agree. #secondchances #youbelong

videos.text: ‚ÄúThe punishment never ends...‚Äù  Let‚Äôs rewrite this story. Second chances isn‚Äôt just about forgiveness; it‚Äôs about believing in the power of redemption and giving everyone the opportunity to thrive.  Every individual deserves a second chance to rewrite their story, especially returning citizens. #SecondChances #youbelong

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Will this be the year probation reform happens in Iowa?! HF 349 is a #probation incentives bill that encourages individuals on probation to pursue education, gain employment, and seek treatment. We already know this works. Incentive programs dramatically decrease repeat offenses, which currently cost Iowa $104 million/year. Our bill focuses on incentivizing workforce development, contributing to a stronger economy, and improving quality of life. Act Now to Support #HF349, we need this! :link: IN BIO #probationreform #iowa #probation #formerlyincarcerated #incarcerated #prisonreform #criminaljustice #criminaljusticereform

videos.author: reform
videos.text: On November 6th, 2017, a pivotal moment unfolded in a Philadelphia courtroom, igniting a movement for justice in the probation and parole system. There, Wallace "Wallo267" Peeples stood alongside many, witnessing the injustice firsthand. That pivotal moment, along with the unwavering commitment of Meek Mill, Michael Rubin, and Jay-Z, gave birth to REFORM Alliance. Five years later our mission is clear. We aim to transform probation and parole by changing laws, systems, and culture to create real pathways to work and well-being. We work to replace America's criminal justice system with a restorative approach that is fair, accountable, and invested in rehabilitation. Our goal is for people to reenter society with dignity, create meaningful pathways to work, and equip them with the tools to succeed, all while making families and communities safer and stronger. Today, we embark on a new chapter with immense pride. We're thrilled to announce Wallace "Wallo267" Peeples as our new Chief Marketing Officer! Wallace's story resonates deeply with REFORM's core values. His journey, marked by both struggle and strength, embodies the transformative power of second chances. His voice, amplified by his platform, is a powerful tool to champion our mission. As CMO, Wallace will be the driving force behind amplifying REFORM's message, mobilizing support, and driving tangible change in our justice system. His leadership, combined with his unique skills will bring our mission to an even wider audience. Join us in welcoming Wallace @WALLO267  Peeples to the REFORM family! #probationreform #changethesystemtogether #secondchances

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Here's a fact: access to higher education reduces the likelihood of individuals returning to prison. But here's another fact: most individuals trapped in the system are not afforded the chance to pursue higher education. Thankfully, there are some incredible programs that exist to bridge this gap while breaking down harmful barriers and stigmas - like the @iuindianapolis class. This unique class brings together campus students studying criminal justice and impacted individuals. They're not only discussing topics like race, racism, sexuality, implicit bias, religion, and politics but also sharing their personal experiences. Our brilliant Indiana state organizer Maranda Williams (@randa019) came to learn more about the program and discuss the reforms we're working to pass in Indiana. Maranda Williams leads the Indiana Secure Communities coalition: a diverse coalition of reentry providers, academics, faith leaders, directly impacted individuals, public servants, advocates, and employers working to improve Indiana's criminal justice system. #criminaljusticereform #changethesystemtogether #indianacheck #indianauniversity #reform #criminaljusticemajor

videos.author: reform
videos.text: 75% remain unemployed one-year post-incarceration due to social stigma and legal restrictions. When individuals have the resources and opportunity to reintegrate successfully, we create safer communities and a larger tax base. Second chances aren‚Äôt just about being compassionate; they‚Äôre about getting people back to work.

videos.author: reform
videos.text: Each of us is more than the worst thing we‚Äôve ever done. ‚ÄúI want people to have compassion towards anyone they know or hear about. Who has gotten themselves on the wrong side of the criminal justice system‚Äù - @mikewinansjr  In a world of second chances, we believe in extending grace. Together, let‚Äôs build bridges to belonging. Share this clip if you agree.

videos.text: @WALLO267  is on parole until 2048. The absurdity of such a lengthy term for someone who has turned his life around is beyond comprehension. videos.text: Celebrating 5 Years of Impact! We‚Äôve come a long way in our mission to reform the justice system. videos.author: reform
videos.text: Latonya was put on probation when she was 12 years old. She thought she was going to be protected, but instead she was prosecuted. Senate Bill 838 will finally retire PA‚Äôs one-size-fits-none approach to probation and will instead embrace evidence-based policies that support the unique needs of folks on probation so they can reclaim their lives, achieve lasting success, and exit the system for good. #sb838 #probationreform #changethesystemtogether #pennsylvaniacheck #probationlaw

videos.author: reform
videos.text: There‚Äôs a workforce crisis in Iowa impacting every industry, and every Iowan is paying the price.¬† Iowa has more job openings than people without jobs, and there are fewer Iowans working today than nearly a decade ago. Chair of the Parole Board in Iowa, Helen Miller, explains how people under supervision remain an untapped talent pool. She stresses the need for vocational programs to help individuals under supervision hone new skills. These programs not only help individuals find stability and safety, but significantly aid the employee shortage. üé§Ô∏è: Iowa State Organizer, @KamMiddlebrooks, leads the Iowans United For Opportunity a coalition: a group of concerned citizens working to improve the Hawkeye State‚Äôs probation system and build stronger, safer, and more prosperous communities. #iowa #iowans #changethesystemtogether #criminaljusticereform #probationreform

videos.author: reform
videos.text: You can accept things for how they are - OR - accept the responsibility for changing them.  We are so grateful to @Michael Rubin and our entire board for utilizing their platform to fix this broken system. Since our founding, we've passed 17 bills in 11 states and we're just getting started!  Text REFORM to 81411 to join the movement!

videos.author: reform
videos.text: ***Watch until the End*** If you listen closely, you‚Äôll quickly understand how non-sensical probation rules can really be. IA State Public Defender Jeff Wright, explains how fines and fees can trap someone in the Iowa probation system for life. Probation should set people up for success, but in Iowa it‚Äôs only weighing people down. Iowans United for Opportunity, a coalition led by our Iowa State Organizer Kam Middlebrooks has a law that could change that and set people up for success. Learn about House File 349.  LINK IN BIO

videos.author: reform
videos.text: When returning citizens have familial support and belong to strong communities, they are more likely to successfully rebuild their lives. REFORM is actively working to foster cultures of empathy and belonging for all so we can create safer communities and empower returning citizens.  Share this post if you agree. #youbelong

videos.author: reform
videos.text: üîÅ ICYMI: We had a major win in IL! üéâ @govpritzker signed supervision reform bill #SB423 in downtown Chicago this past summer alongside our CEO @rdrooks, @meekmill, @michaelrubin along with several other leaders and community activists. Senate Bill 423 incentivizes positive behavior and eliminates barriers that get in the way of success, plain and simple. Would you like to see reforms like this in your state?

videos.author: reform
videos.text: The thing about being on supervision is that it‚Äôs like a second sentence.  Even if you‚Äôre doing all the right things, and staying on track, there‚Äôs always a chance you can be sent back to prison for breaking an arbitrary rule, like forgetting to report a traffic ticket.  At Reform, we believe individuals should be held accountable, and also ‚Äì that they should be given the tools and guidance to get their lives back on track.  What is one thing you wish was different about the supervision system?
